intro: Adicea pachycarpa, commonly known as the thick-fruited adicea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and fleshy, berry-like fruits that contain a high concentration of alkaloids. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Adicea pachycarpa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
